tn.ref: he will let you go from here
tn.text: Each occurrence of the word "you" in this verse is plural and refers to Moses and the rest of the Israelites. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
This is the time of 12 am (at night) or 2400 hours.

tn.ref: All the firstborn ... the firstborn of Pharaoh ... the firstborn of the slave girl ... the firstborn of the cattle
tn.text: The "firstborn" always refers to the oldest male offspring.

tn.ref: who is behind the handmill grinding it
tn.text: "who is grinding at the handmill" or "who is behind the handmill grinding grain"

tn.ref: After that I will go out
tn.text: This means that Moses and the people of Israel will leave Egypt. AT: "After that I will leave here" or "After that I will go out from Egypt" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

Here "heart" refers to Pharaoh. His stubborn attitude is spoken of as if his heart was hard. See how you translated this phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:09:11|9:12]]. AT: "Yahweh caused Pharaoh to became more defiant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
